name: Trumbull Marriott Merritt Parkway

reviews.text: I love this hotel so much!!!!!! Nice rooms, pools, J Porters has the best Clam Chowder, nice lounge, fitness center, tons of brochures, breakfast, nice to get out, chill and enjoy it at this hotel but do not use the shampoo or conditioner inside and do not get wet hair in jacuzzi but anyway stay!!!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel!!!!

reviews.text: I stayed here when working in the area - it is right off of a major highway, but not noisy at all. The rooms are more upscale than a typical Marriott, with wood floors in the entryway to the room and granite in the shower. My room was a little bit bigger than the typical room with enough space for a couch and coffee table without feeling cramped (comparable to NYC Marriott Marquis if you have been there). The landscaping is beautiful, and I loved the outdoor pool area. They had a poolside grill but it was not open when I was there (maybe only on weekends?) There is also an indoor pool and gym. There is an upscale steakhouse in the hotel - I never ate there but ordered room service and it was better than typical Marriott food. Parking is free but not covered. I will definitely stay here again - I felt like I was on vacation instead of a business trip.
reviews.title: Upscale Marriott - more than a business hotel
Beautiful rooms
reviews.text: I stayed on business at the Trumbull Marriott. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very nice. There is a large safe for your laptop and plenty of storage for clothes in the dresser and closet. The room also has a refrigerator and coffee maker. I give the room five stars. The bed was very comfortable as well. The TV in my room quit on me and they offered to move me because they could not swap it out. They did come right away and try to fix it but they could not. I did not want to move. It may have been the cable service and luckily, it was fixed by the next day. The thing that I did not like about this hotel is they charge you $12.95 per day for wireless internet access. This is crazy and so I just used my phone to answer some emails while out of the office. They should really give this to people just like most other hotels do these days.

I did not eat in the restaurant. I was there for meetings that were catered by the hotel and the food was really good. Surprisingly good hotel catering food. Overall, this was a pleasant place that I would recommend to others. They just have to stop being stingy with the internet service charge.
reviews.title: Perfectly Fine Business Hotel

reviews.text: It's clean, well appointed, and very convenient if you are visiting a business in the area, which is pretty rural. The restaurant was surpisingly good plus it's the only one you can get to without a car. The only downside is the fact that you should call a taxi well in advance of when you need one. They are called in; they don't line up outside the door.
reviews.title: Great location.....good value for your money

reviews.text: The room was lovely, nice combination of wood floors and carpet, very clean and comfy. No complaints about the room. The hot tub was nuce and clean and powerful jets, the pool looked nice and was warm to the touch. There was no vending machine for snacks just soda, however there is a gift shop with snacks which is not always opened but they opened it for us. The restaurant looked nice and big, we did order room service breakfast which was very good but expensive. We got a group rate one night because we were there for a seminar, we did ask for the same rate or similar for another night and they could't match it the rate actually doubled the next night. There is a 15 minute drive to most restaurants in the area, we drove to red lobster which was a huge mistake, it was Saturday night and very crowded and lots of characters. All in all really nice hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel but overpriced.

reviews.text: This hotel is so nice! They have nice clean rooms, they do laundry and we get to swim until 11pm and they have such good clam chowder! I only hate the high expense of breakfast and j porters dinner. They have such nice features but their food is so expensive
reviews.title: Best hotel ever!
It works
reviews.text: If you are looking for a convenient hotel in the Trumbull area - this works. It feels a bit like an 80's, anonymous, convention/business hotel that has gone thru updates to keep up. The room is functional and clean and you can work in it. The beds are not especially comfortable, but the linens clean. I appreciate the fact that there are healthy breakfast options offered via room service. Each staff member I interacted with was friendly and helpful.

Decided to lodge at the Trumbull Marriott during my visit to see my daughter at Fairfield University (which is approximately 11 miles from campus). The staff and service were terrific. The room was exceptionally clean and the check in process easy, simple and effortless. The check in staff greeted me in a friendly welcoming approach. Enjoyed the breakfast and dinner in the hotel restaurant. I will plan to stay again upon my return to the area!
reviews.title: Excellent, Clean and Convenient!

reviews.text: Decent as far as room and facilities are concerned but the staff came across as indifferent, in particular the lady at room service. The food menu is very very limited with hardly any choice ... and there are no decent restaurants within striking distance. If you have a choice, you can avoid this one!
reviews.title: Don't stay there if you have a choice...

reviews.text: While this hotel isn't anything special in the grand scheme of hotels, the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. Whether it was the front desk, room service, handyman, etc, everyone was incredibly nice - and that is something you don't always get. The front desk was very kind in suggesting where to eat, what to see, printing us directions to and from places(since where this hotel is, you can never really seem to get back the same way you left).
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.text: The hotel itself was alright: room was fine, good selection of tv channels, nice (but small) indoor pool and hot tub, etc. Everything was clean and worked, so that was nice.
reviews.title: Great hotel for business travel

reviews.text: Overall a nice few days spent here, and if I was ever in the area again, I wouldn't hesitate to stay.
reviews.title: Decent enough for a one time stay

reviews.text: I stay at this hotel for business twice monthly and find the staff very helpful. I like the comfort of the hotel and the restaurant on site, I do not feel as though I have to leave the hotel to find a place to eat. Also, in the summer, you can sit poolside and have something to eat as well. There are nice patio rooms on the first floor which over look the pool, which is a nice option when wanting to get some fresh air.
reviews.title: Horrible service with good food...

reviews.text: This Marriott is decent enough. It is clean, has a restuarant and bar, meeting rooms, etc. Standard stuff. However, it seems to suffer from a lot of little misses. For example, the gift shop is always closed (there is a sign telling you to go find someone at the front desk to help you). The rooms are loud. The elevators are old. The parking lots fill up early. The iron in the room was broken. The front desk clerk's suit coat hadn't been cleaned in some time. The hotel's cable system had channels come in and out (i.e. sometimes CNN or other channels would work, sometimes they didn't).
reviews.title: Wonderful Time

reviews.text: Stayed there before The Game in New Haven. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. This hotel is very new and modern with wood floors in the rooms and all the modern creature comforts. The prices are good too! Bar wasnt that great but breakfast buffet was excellent. At check in, my buddy wanted to use his Marriott frequent stayer card but let me pay for the room. The clerk copped a tude but then melted and laughed and let us do it. After I got in the room, he called up to see if everything was fine as we expected. Never seen that before from even the Ritz Carlton. Large warm cookies upon check in. I recommend this place if you want to avoid the hassles of Yale area.
reviews.title: Modern Relaxing and Enjoyable

reviews.text: I called during the day to book a regular room, kind size bed. When I arrived in the evening, upon checking in at the reservation desk, the clerk announced that I had been "upgraded " to a special suite because I am a "silver" Marriott Rewards member. I knew, of course, that I was a rewards program member, but had not heard about a "silver" membership level. I asked what that entailed, and she said, basically, an upgrade to this suite. I went up the suite, dropped my bags, and headed out for dinner.
reviews.title: Reservations lied about room: first time had that happen ever.

reviews.text: After dinner, I checked out the suite. It was not what you might be thinking. Most suites are just normal hotel rooms, but with an extra living room/space. This room was actually just a business meeting room. There was a large room, living room sized room, which had a big conference table with ten leather conference chairs, a wet bar, wine fridge, etc. Next to this room was another space - open, not separated as a distinct bedroom - which had two arm chairs, some tables, and, guess what, no bed. Where to sleep? Turns out that there WAS a bed, a Murphy bed, which pulls down from the wall (just like in those black and white movies) ... cute, except that the bed is bad. No box spring, just one, thinner than usual top mattress sitting on a slab of wood. So, basically, you're sleeping on a fancy cot.
reviews.title: Fighting in Hallways of a Marriott?Bloodstains on the sheets?

reviews.text: It was now midnight, and I called the front desk for another room, after trying out the Murphy and realizing I wasn't going to get a good night's sleep. The night auditor answered, and when I explained, he said there were no other rooms available, they were sold out. Why didn't they tell me that when I called earlier in the day to make a reservation, and was told a regular room with a king bed was available? Or, even if there was a mistake and they didn't realize, when I called during that day, that a normal room wasn't available, why didn't they at least tell me when I checked in? Because if they'd told me I wasn't getting a normal bed, I wouldn't have checked in. Clearly, someone had decided to make up the story that I was getting a fabulous free upgrade because I am a Silver member (not sure there really is such a thing) as a way of getting me into the one and only room available. I was really mad about the lie, much more so than about a good room not being available. The auditor offered a 50% discount on the room, but what I really needed was a good bed. Had a meeting there in Trumball the next morning, then would have to drive to NYC for a late afternoon meeting, then on to Boston in the evening after that.
reviews.title: Great Rooms & Service

reviews.text: I own my own small business, and, like any business, we sometimes make mistakes. If a mistake impacts a client, though, I call the client, admit the mistake, and suggest what we'd like to do to fix it. I don't lie to try to keep them happy.
reviews.title: Clean and quiet

description: Located just off the Merritt Parkway, the Trumbull Marriott is a Fairfield County hotel that is ideally located in the heart of Connecticut's Fortune 500 corporations. These Fairfield accommodations feature 324 guest rooms, 17 meeting rooms and 15 breakout rooms.
